meanings.definition: To come to live permanently in a foreign country
meanings.sent1: My grandparents immigrated from Italy to the United States many years ago.
meanings.sent2: Many families have immigrated to this city seeking better opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to have immigrated to the dog's bed, claiming it as its own territory.
meanings.sent4: The idea of living on Mars feels like immigrating to a whole new world.
meanings.sent5: The image of the birds immigrating to warmer lands stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To enter and usually become established; especially: to come into a country of which one is not a native for permanent residence
meanings.sent1: The family immigrated through the border and settled in the new country.
meanings.sent2: Many people have immigrated to this region, bringing diverse cultures with them.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to immigrate into the birdhouse, thinking it was a cozy tree.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to immigrate into a realm of creativity and inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the painting seemed to immigrate into each other, creating a beautiful blend.
